forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. West southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As the night whispers into the early hours, Downtown San Francisco finds itself shrouded in a layer of soft clouds, likely lingering from the cool embrace of the Pacific. The temperature rests comfortably around 55 degrees, with a gentle west-southwest breeze that sways the treetops and carries a hint of ocean salt. As dawn approaches, the city will begin to awaken under blankets of gray, gradually stepping into a sunlit embrace as the day unfolds. The forecast promises a transformation, shifting to mostly sunny skies by midday. Though the high won't soar dramatically—hovering near a modest 65—temperatures will slide gracefully to about 62 by afternoon, keeping the day refreshingly crisp.

The allure of a late afternoon stroll along the Embarcadero is undeniable. One might dress in layers—a light sweater or a breathable jacket, perfect for the morning chill that gives way to a more inviting warmth. Perhaps a casual café visit, where the delightful aroma of fresh coffee mingles with sea air, calls out to the early riser. Throughout the day, one may savor the clarity that unfolds, as distant views like the Golden Gate Bridge emerge from the fog, inviting spontaneous adventures or quiet contemplation at waterfront parks. In this city where every twist and turn reveals a new layer, it’s a perfect Sunday to take in the sights while recognizing the dynamic beauty that defines San Francisco, whether shrouded in mist or basking in sunlight.
